title: How to Make an Emoji Pillow

steps.headline: Put two pieces of yellow felt on top of each other.
steps.description: This article will teach you how to make the emoji face with heart eyes.

steps.headline: Grab a circular plate or anything else that is circular and place it on your felt.
Trace around the circular object with pencil on the top piece of felt.
steps.description: You will need to push down hard with the pencil so the pencil markings will be visible. Try hard not to make any mistakes!

steps.headline: Cut the circles out together try to cut them out exactly the same this will help the pillow turn out better!
Hot glue gun (or sew) the two circles together all the way around leaving a small gap.
steps.description: The small gap should just be big enough so that you are able to fit your hand in.

steps.headline: Put your hand through the gap and turn what you have inside out.
With polyester or toy stuffing, stuff your pillow.
Hot glue gun (or sew) the small space you left once you have stuffed your pillow.
Using index cards or any white card, draw out stencils!
steps.description: To make the heart eyed emoji, you will need to draw one heart and cut it out and then you will need to draw a mouth and cut it out.

steps.headline: Trace the stencils onto your pillow with a pencil.
steps.description: Remember to push down hard once again, but try not to make any mistakes!

steps.headline: Using puffy or fabric paint, go around the outline that you did in pencil.
Fill the shapes in slightly and use a paintbrush to blend the paint in!
Wait for everything to dry overnight.
Finished - you now have your very own emoji pillow.

text: Put two pieces of yellow felt on top of each other. This article will teach you how to make the emoji face with heart eyes. Grab a circular plate or anything else that is circular and place it on your felt.  Trace around the circular object with pencil on the top piece of felt. You will need to push down hard with the pencil so the pencil markings will be visible. Try hard not to make any mistakes! Cut the circles out together try to cut them out exactly the same this will help the pillow turn out better!  Hot glue gun (or sew) the two circles together all the way around leaving a small gap. The small gap should just be big enough so that you are able to fit your hand in. Put your hand through the gap and turn what you have inside out.  With polyester or toy stuffing, stuff your pillow.  Hot glue gun (or sew) the small space you left once you have stuffed your pillow.  Using index cards or any white card, draw out stencils! To make the heart eyed emoji, you will need to draw one heart and cut it out and then you will need to draw a mouth and cut it out. Trace the stencils onto your pillow with a pencil. Remember to push down hard once again, but try not to make any mistakes! Using puffy or fabric paint, go around the outline that you did in pencil.  Fill the shapes in slightly and use a paintbrush to blend the paint in!  Wait for everything to dry overnight.  Finished - you now have your very own emoji pillow.
